Smell of sewage and cloudy water with brown debris in the canal downstream of Berkhamsted sewage treatment works, Bullbeggars Lane, and flowing into Bulbourne - apparently it has been like this for days. @EnvAgency @thameswater is sewage being released? #chalkstreams https://t.co/6LTNy1Am4r

243 documented violations in 2 years and not a single prosecution. And guess what? Yep, you got it.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/VvjLy78nDI

The Environment Agency has failed to prosecute or fine any violations of the Farming Rules For Water. There have been 243 documented breaches since 2018 - but experts say breaches are widespread and usually go undocumented. https://t.co/BFoNAOvnIC

The #GreenRecoveryChallengeFund is back. Another ¬£40m will be up for grabs as @HeritageFundUK seeks projects prioritising the #environment.
The scheme is funded by @DefraGovUK and co-led by NLHF @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @EnvAgency https://t.co/ScbfvWFhg8

Climate change means #flood events previously categorised with a likelihood of 1 in 100 years, may happen every 15, 10 or 5 years...Find out how we can become better prepared and read our very own, Elena Kuvshinova's, latest thoughts on @YorkshirePFR ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/KEAIV96TYu https://t.co/U8AIO7ivTb

tweets.text: @DickiejMiller Sewage treatment works will operate under discharge consent orders, which limits the amount of discharge and its quality. If there are obvious signs of pollution, like wildlife in distress and strong discolouration, contact the hotline so it can be checked.

tweets.text:
Can you help us in our fight against #WasteCrime? 

We've launched a Waste Crime Survey to help us build a better intelligence picture across the country. 

Your responses will be kept confidential and anonymous. 

Complete the survey here: https://t.co/THxMyWjzgX https://t.co/2s6TGQONnn
3/3 But in the meantime we are keeping an eye on this and thank everyone who alerted us. If you see pollution in a river, report it to our 24/7 hotline 0800 807060.

1/3 Pollution can enter rivers and watercourses from the land through subsidence, run off caused by rain or be permitted in limited quantities in certain locations if environmental impact is kept minimal. https://t.co/mnTYkny0GB

@whamsfarm @EnvAgencyNW @TheFloodHub Hi Neil -  during 2020 we removed 10,000 tonnes of gravel through #Kendal  in locations where it makes a real difference to reducing flood risk to homes and businesses - the CIWEM report is an interesting read https://t.co/CP8r4ylZ1M
@EnvAgencyNW @TheFloodHub @stewart_mounsey I sure 2% of that would dredge the river and have a better affect against flooding and be far more beneficial to the environment. And a lot faster!

We have started embankment works today as part of the Torksey #Flood Risk Management Scheme in north #Lincolnshire. 
Once complete 450+ properties will benefit from reduced #flood risk from the River Trent. https://t.co/WsnvYOYNjP

"I must stress to constituents at the outset that there is next-to-no chance of this bill, as presented, passing through Parliament and becoming law.‚Äù What a waste of time. More plasterboard shredded into fines? ü§î @EnvAgency https://t.co/Xc8OVxXlIL

Working with @WestcountryRT and @NESouthWest we have removed Keybridge Weir on the De Lank River, a tributary of the R Camel in north Cornwall, opening up 3k of river for fish.  The weir had been a barrier to fish migration for more than 100 years. #partnership https://t.co/2V0thDWNzO
Live or work in #Oxford? Our Oxford Flood Scheme team is planning virtual events to keep you updated, and would like to hear from you. https://t.co/s2VTY5XXUZ

entity.name: Good Morning Britain
entity.description: Good morning, Britain. Up early and need to catch up on the latest news, weather and sports? Then this weekday morning programme is for you, offering the latest information in such areas as entertainment, health and money. `Good Morning Britain' is the typical morning news and talk show. It features a number of presenters, correspondents and reporters covering what you should know to start your day before heading out the door.

urls.title: Youth Voice Summit - Rethinking Water
urls.description: A chance for you to input your opinions and experiences on future water management and how you would like to engage in giving your opinion in the decisions made by the Environment Agency in the future.

tweets.text:
Providing a platform for young people's voices, @OBrightFuture would like to hear your opinions on future water management, youth engagement and future governance. 

Webinar: 16 March - 5-7pm

Sign up here üëâ https://t.co/5KNDFZX1CI

@WildlifeTrusts @EnvAgency https://t.co/EKIJc7qlMX

Join us for Youth Voice Summit: Rethinking Water! We have teamed up with @EnvAgency and would like to know young people‚Äôs opinions on future water management, youth engagement and future governance.

Find out more and sign up by clicking the link below.
https://t.co/Gmx3uHGWJI https://t.co/AfSUAaCDfn
